availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Bazel Hall (Powell county convict for forgery in KY Pen)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky convict in the Kentucky State Penitentiary. Powell County, Kentucky native. Son of Henry W. Hall and Lucinda Hall. Sentenced to the Kentucky State Penitentiary for forgery in Madison County.

bibl.p: KYR-0001-029-0570. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 53. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 20. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct 2, Subdivision 144, p. 21. “Bazzel Duke Hall (1847-1925),” Find A Grave, memorial no. 95923180, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSln=HALL&GSpartial=1&GSbyrel=all&GSst=26&GScntry=4&GSsr=561&GRid=95923180& (accessed June 11, 2017).
